danfulea.phys

Class XRaySpectrum

  • java.lang.Object
    • danfulea.phys.XRaySpectrum

  • public class XRaySpectrum
extends java.lang.Object
    Build X-Ray spectrum.
    Author:
    Dan Fulea, 11 APR. 2005

    • Constructor Detail

      • XRaySpectrum

        public XRaySpectrum()
        Constructor. Mono-energetic spectrum used in Mammography.

      • XRaySpectrum

        public XRaySpectrum(double kv,
                    double filtration,
                    double anodAngle)
        Constructor. General X-Ray spectrum.
        Parameters:
        kv - tube voltage
        filtration - tube filtration (total or equivalent in mmAl)
        anodAngle - the anode angle. If not known, a good default value is 17 degrees.

    • Method Detail

      • getNormalizedValue

        public double getNormalizedValue()
        Get the number used for spectrum normalization (i.e. the intensities must be divided with this value). Used in Monte Carlo simulations. If ICALC =1 this is given in photons/mAs/mm^2 at 75 cm distance from the tube.
        Returns:
        the result

      • getPhotonFlux

        public double getPhotonFlux()
        Return the photon flux for Monte Carlo simulations. If SRS78 is used (ICALC=1), this is given in photons/mAs/mm^2 at 75 cm distance from the tube.
        Returns:
        the result

      • getAirKerma

        public double getAirKerma()
        Return the air kerma for Monte Carlo simulations. If SRS78 is used (ICALC=1), this is given in uGy/mAs computed at 75 cm distance from tube.
        Returns:
        the result

      • getXRayEnergies

        public double[] getXRayEnergies()
        Return the array of X-Ray energies in keV.
        Returns:
        the result

      • getXRayIntensities

        public double[] getXRayIntensities()
        Return the X-ray intensities. If SRS78 is used (ICALC=1), this is given in photons/mAs/mm^2 at 75 cm distance from the tube.
        Returns:
        the result

      • getXRayPlotPanel

        public javax.swing.JPanel getXRayPlotPanel()
        Returns the graphic panel containing the spectrum plot.
        Returns:
        the result

      • linInt

        private double linInt(double x1,
                      double y1,
                      double x2,
                      double y2,
                      double x)
        Linear interpolation.
        Parameters:
        x1 - first point x-value
        y1 - first point y-value
        x2 - second point x-value
        y2 - second point y-value
        x - desire point x-value
        Returns:
        desire point y-value

      • generateSpectrum

        private void generateSpectrum()
        Generates the unattenuated X-Ray spectrum. Called by constructor.
